comments.body: Can you add a comment why you get api.ConditionFull instead of api.ConditionUnknown, even though the current probe is unhealthy? I assume it is because the timeout has not passed yet.
Oh, this method is testing sync probed node status, not monitoring node status, see TestMonitorNodeStatusUpdateStatus
Add a comment why this is fakeNow instead of node.CreationTimestamp. I guess this is the first transition, from Unknown (when node was just created) to Full?

As this is expanding quickly, can you add some comments on each case:
1. test setup
2. expectation

We shouldn't test by method, we need to test by behavior, i.e. this method probably needs to be splitted to multiple ones.  I'm fine with it right now.
Shouldn't this be ConditionNone?  Though I think probably doesn't matter for this method (Test Transitiontime).
No, Check comment in L690, existing node is schedulable so it should be ConditionFull.

I meant to comment on next one...  github's review folds too much.  But looks like you also comment existing node is also schedulable.  It looks weired though, with spec not schedulable and condition scheduable

The use case we are testing here is to verify last transition time change for the node condition. For this scenario, test case setup:
(a) Current node status is schedulable 
(b) Now user desired node to be not schedulable (updated in spec) but status is not updated yet  to reflect this desire.
Test execution:
   Test case will update the status (obeys the spec and marks NodeSchedulable to ConditionNone) and ensures there is change in last transition time.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +736,740 @@								{
									Type:               api.NodeSchedulable,
									Status:             api.ConditionFull,
									Reason:             "Node is schedulable by default",
									LastTransitionTime: util.Date(2012, 1, 1, 0, 0, 0, 0, time.UTC),
